steps.prompt_body: List the top stakeholders you’ll interact with and what each one quietly wants.
examples: CFO wants proof the plan protects margin. VP Product cares about launch timing.
Client sponsor wants reassurance the migration won’t derail Q3 metrics.

helper.title: Map the room
bullets: Call out the skeptic or blocker.

steps.prompt_body: Describe the moment you expect pushback or friction. What triggers it?
examples: Budget doubt will spike when I outline the additional headcount ask.
Legal will challenge the new data-sharing clause.

helper.title: Spot the flashpoint
bullets: Is it cost, risk, or control?
What happens if you ignore it?

steps.prompt_body: Write one action you’ll take to earn or reinforce an ally before the meeting.
examples: Send the COO a one-page preview so she can co-sign the risk mitigation plan.
Check in with the client champion to confirm the success metrics.

steps.prompt_body: State the single sentence you want every stakeholder to remember.
examples: “This rollout protects uptime while unlocking $2.1M in new revenue.”
“By giving Ops the data feed, we cut decision time in half.”

steps.prompt_body: Describe how you’ll show up in the room—tone, pacing, and first question.
examples: Open with a calm recap, then ask the CFO what success looks like six months post-launch.
Use a 2-4 breath before speaking; keep tone warm but confident.
